instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3208: What is 820-3208? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PP3V3_S5: What is PP3V3_S5? PP3V3_S5 is a 3.3v power rail when the system is in an S5 soft off power state.
definitions.PP3V42_G3H: What is PP3V42_G3H? PP3V42_G3H is a power rail present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state and is the first rail that should be generated in Macbooks that use it. .
definitions.PP5V_S5: What is PP5V_S5? This is a 5v power rail that is present when the machine is in an S5 soft off state..
definitions.SMC_RESET_L: What is SMC_RESET_L? SMC_RESET_L puts the SMC into reset mode when it is low, _L means the signal is present when voltage is low. The SMC being in reset mode keeps it from running..
definitions.PPVRTC_G3H: What is PPVRTC_G3H? PPVRTC_G3H is a 3.3v power rail for the RTC circuit present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state. .
definitions.PPBUS_S5_HS_COMPUTING_ISNS: What is PPBUS_S5_HS_COMPUTING_ISNS? This power rail is PPBUS_G3H after going through a current sense resistor that sits between PPBUS_G3H & the input of PPBUS_G3H to circuitry that provides power for the CPU..
definitions.PPDCIN_G3H_ISOL: What is PPDCIN_G3H_ISOL? This is the voltage coming directly from the charger after going through a transistor. .
definitions.PPBUS_S5_HS_OTHER_ISNS: What is PPBUS_S5_HS_OTHER_ISNS? This is PPBUS_G3H after passing through a current sense resistor that splits it off from the rest of PPBUS_G3H. The purpose of this is so that we can measure how much current is flowing to this part of the machine..
definitions.R6905: What is R6905? Resistor between charger voltage and input to PP3V42_G3H power supply on older Macbooks, pre-2011 models. This resistor blows when C6990 has shorted to ground or U6990 has shorted to ground, and will result in PP3V42_G3H missing and the magsafe charger not having a light since PP3V42_G3H is necessary for the SMC to turn on and the onewire circuit to turn on..
definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.
definitions.ISL6259: What is ISL6259? This is a charging chip for Macbook motherboards from 2010 through 2015.
definitions.PP3V3_S0: What is PP3V3_S0? The "PP3V3_S0" rail in a MacBook logic board is a power rail that supplies 3.3 volts to the system when it is fully awake (S0 state). .
definitions.PPVCORE_S0_CPU: What is PPVCORE_S0_CPU? This is the primary power rail for the CPU that powers the CPU, known as CPU vcore. Without this, the machine will be braindead. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3208</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No turning on, fan spins 1 seg every 5 seg.
threads.message:
Hi, i have a macbook air <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3208</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> here.

measures: 

<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> @ <RESISTOR>R6920</RESISTOR> 8,37v (8,34v when fan spins thats one seg)
<SIGNAL>PPVIN_SW_TBTBST</SIGNAL> @ <CAPACITOR>C3891</CAPACITOR> 0,94v to 1,90v fluctuating every seg
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_S5_HS_COMPUTING_ISNS</SIGNAL> @ <CAPACITOR>C7516</CAPACITOR> 8,37v (8,36-8,35 when fan spins)
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_S5_HS_OTHER_ISNS</SIGNAL> @ <CAPACITOR>C7200</CAPACITOR> 8,37v (8,35v when spins)
<SIGNAL>PPDCIN_G3H_ISOL</SIGNAL> @ <RESISTOR>R6905</RESISTOR> 16,93v (16,88v when spins)
<SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL> @ <RESISTOR>R5077</RESISTOR> 3,42v stable
<SIGNAL>PPVRTC_G3H</SIGNAL> @ <RESISTOR>R1801</RESISTOR> 3.33v stable
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL> @ L5720 5,01v (5,12 when spins)
<SIGNAL>PP5V_SUS</SIGNAL> @ <CAPACITOR>C7840</CAPACITOR> 5,05v stable
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL> @ <CAPACITOR>C9480</CAPACITOR> 3,33v stable
<SIGNAL>SMC_RESET_L</SIGNAL> @ <RESISTOR>R5000</RESISTOR> 3,38v stable

green light and orange light but no turning on, no spin continuosly.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3208</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No turning on, fan spins 1 seg every 5 seg.
threads.message: Power pulsing on L7510 too? Was this liquid?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3208</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No turning on, fan spins 1 seg every 5 seg.
threads.message:
[QUOTE="dukefawks, post: 21951"]Power pulsing on L7510 too? Was this liquid?[/QUOTE]

No, i have 0,00v here no pulsing. the board has a little bit of liquid damage but i clean very well

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3208</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No turning on, fan spins 1 seg every 5 seg.
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3208</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No turning on, fan spins 1 seg every 5 seg.
threads.message:
We do sleep from time to time!

Where was the liquid? 

No pulsing on CPU vcore is no good. 

What does <CHIP>U2700</CHIP> area look like? How high does <SIGNAL>SYSCLK_CLK32K_RTC</SIGNAL> voltage spike? What's the resistance between pins 17/18 on <CHIP>U7000</CHIP>? Do you have any short circuits to ground on <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S0</SIGNAL> and other S0 rails? 

On everything before 2013 most common quarter fan spin causes are clock and battery-side current sensing on the <CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP>, but usually that does come with CPU vcore - so I'll be waiting for you to tell me where the corrosion was so we can go further.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3208</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No turning on, fan spins 1 seg every 5 seg.
threads.message:
[QUOTE="larossmann, post: 21983"]We do sleep from time to time!

Where was the liquid?

No pulsing on CPU vcore is no good.

What does <CHIP>U2700</CHIP> area look like? How high does <SIGNAL>SYSCLK_CLK32K_RTC</SIGNAL> voltage spike? What's the resistance between pins 17/18 on <CHIP>U7000</CHIP>? Do you have any short circuits to ground on <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S0</SIGNAL> and other S0 rails?

On everything before 2013 most common quarter fan spin causes are clock and battery-side current sensing on the <CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP>, but usually that does come with CPU vcore - so I'll be waiting for you to tell me where the corrosion was so we can go further. [/QUOTE]

Liquid was spill near the spi area and the <CHIP>U6210</CHIP> area but not to much... the area around the <CHIP>U2700</CHIP> looks aceptable.. have some red points but nothing serious.. The <SIGNAL>SYSCLK_CLK32K_RTC</SIGNAL> At pin 12 of the <CHIP>U2700</CHIP> have 0.43v stable.. The resistance between pin 17/18 on <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> is 03.0 ohms .. On <SIGNAL>PPVCORE_S0_CPU</SIGNAL> have 03,3 ohms.. :(
